title: Water in a tank: piecewise function find maximum

content.description:
The amount of water in a storage tank, in gallons, is modeled by a continuous function on the time interval <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mn>0</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>7</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3BF2@</annotation> </semantics> </math>, where t is measured in hours. In this model, rates are given as follows:

The rate at which water enters the tank is <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>100</mn><msup> <mi>t</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> <mi>sin</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo> <mrow> <msqrt> <mi>t</mi> </msqrt> </mrow> <mo>)</mo></mrow> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@449D@</annotation> </semantics> </math> gallons per hour for <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mn>0</mn> <mo>≤</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>≤</mo> <mn>7</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3BF2@</annotation> </semantics> </math>.

The rate at which water enters the tank is <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>g</mi> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> <mo>=</mo> <mo>{</mo> <mtable> <mtr> <mtd> <mrow> <mn>250</mn> <mtext>   for </mtext> <mn>0</mn> <mo>≤</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo><</mo> <mn>3</mn> </mrow> </mtd> </mtr> <mtr> <mtd> <mrow> <mn>2000</mn> <mtext> for </mtext> <mn>3</mn> <mo><</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>≤</mo> <mn>7</mn> </mrow> </mtd> </mtr> </mtable> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@5631@</annotation> </semantics> </math> gallons per hour.

The graphs of f and g, which intersect at t = 1.617 and t = 5.076, are shown in the figure above. At time t = 0, the amount of water in the tank is 5000 gallons.
content.question: For <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mn>0</mn> <mo>≤</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>≤</mo> <mn>7</mn> </mrow> <annotation>MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaaGimaiabgs MiJkaadshacqGHKjYOcaaI3aaaaa@3BD4@</annotation> </semantics> </math> , at what time t is the amount of water in the tank greatest? To the nearest gallon, compute the amount of water at this time. Justify your answer.

frqParts.text: For <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mn>0</mn> <mo>≤</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>≤</mo> <mn>7</mn> </mrow> <annotation>MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaaGimaiabgs MiJkaadshacqGHKjYOcaaI3aaaaa@3BD4@</annotation> </semantics> </math> , at what time t is the amount of water in the tank greatest? To the nearest gallon, compute the amount of water at this time. Justify your answer.
